headline: Video: How we studied the lessons of Ukraine
description: Inside our correspondent’s investigation into the future of war

children.data: ’s defence editor, has spent months analysing how technology is reshaping warfare. Artificial intelligence, drones and satellites are increasingly changing the characteristics of war, but old lessons still matter. Here he explores what can be learned from the Ukraine war, which has become a testbed for technologies of the future.

bodyText: Shashank Joshi, The Economist’s defence editor, has spent months analysing how technology is reshaping warfare. Artificial intelligence, drones and satellites are increasingly changing the characteristics of war, but old lessons still matter. Here he explores what can be learned from the Ukraine war, which has become a testbed for technologies of the future.

print.headline: Video: How we studied the lessons of Ukraine

parts.headline: Battlefield lessons
parts.description: The war shows how technology is changing the battlefield. But mass still counts, argues Shashank Joshi

parts.headline: The war in Ukraine shows how technology is changing the battlefield
parts.description: But mass still counts, argues Shashank Joshi in the first of seven chapters of a special report on the future of warfare

parts.headline: The latest in the battle of jamming with electronic beams
parts.description: Jamming is knocking drones and missiles out of the sky

parts.headline: The latest in the battle of jamming with electronic beams
parts.description: Jamming is knocking drones and missiles out of the sky

parts.headline: Why logistics are too important to be left to the generals
parts.description: Russia’s invasion shows how war can hinge on logistics

parts.headline: Technology is deepening civilian involvement in war
parts.description: Another chapter in our special report on the future of warfare considers the big legal questions raised by the fusion of civilian and military activity

parts.headline: How Ukraine’s enemy is also learning lessons, albeit slowly
parts.description: Russia is also absorbing lessons from the war

parts.headline: How oceans became new technological battlefields
parts.description: Ukraine has repelled the Black Sea Fleet. But naval drones may not be enough to defeat it

parts.headline: Western armies are learning a lot from the war in Ukraine
parts.description: Ukraine is teaching armies to think, train and plan differently
